frameDefinitions: These words describe the size of message that a Speaker is judged by a (usually unexpressed)
In this frame either a Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the Experiencer or  saliently fails to bring about a particular experience.
An Experiencer is in a State where a biological urge is signaling the need to perform a certain action such as eating, drinking, stopping exertion, sleeping, regurgitating, or having sex.
A physical Exerter, Action, or Force exerts energy at a level specified by the target.
An Entity is judged by a sound Attribute of some perceived level of Volume intensity.
frameExamples: Graham is very shy with most people, but he gets very <t>chatty</t> with Mr. Roberts.
Although an <t>energetic</t> and able warrior, Charlemagne tended to direct battles rather than fight in person.
listRoleDefinitions: This is the person who is characterized as talkative, reticent etc.  It is usually the External Argument:

<fen>Text</fen> is rarely expressed because the quantity of information given is the focus of the frame, rather than the information content. Texts can occur as NP objects, but cannot be either direct quotes or complement clauses.
This role is the <fen>Topic</fen> on which much or little information is communicated. <fen>Topic</fen> is far more frequent than Message in this frame.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the object or event which brings about the emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> receives the biological signal and possesses the internal experience which is a reaction to the phsyical signal.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is used for a gesture, expression, or body part indicating that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is feeling a certain urge.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels the biological signal. <fen>Time</fen> may also allow inference about the <fen>Reason</fen> for the biological urge.
This role identifies the  <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels the biological signal.
The <fen>Action</fen> that exerts an energy of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> which exerts an energy of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that exerts an energy of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> exerts an energy.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> exerts its energy.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the sound level <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under consideration. This role is incorporated in each LU in the frame.
A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Volume</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Volume</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The place where an <fen>Entity</fen> is located.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> has been silent on this issue.
Kim is very talkative <fex>about her family and childhood</fex>.
He gave me a tired <fex>shrug</fex> and then looked down again.
She was alarmed by John's hungry <fex>state</fex>.
He was given a vigorous <fex>slap</fex> on the ear for his behavior.
More deadly and painful is the chemical weaponry of the camouflaged but lethargic <fex>stonefish</fex>.
They were trying to harness some of the lightening's intense <fex>power</fex>.
Charlie's workout was intense even <fex>first thing in the morning</fex>.
Because of the added space, our ultimate frisbee game was more vigorous <fex>in Golden Gate Park</fex>.
